text: Duke Energy's mission

is to lead our industry's most aggressive
clean energy transition.

We anticipate 26 million
electric vehicles will be on the road

by 2030,
and 80% of those will be charged at home.

That along with additional footprint
of renewable energy sources

and the resilience required
as we go through

an electrification of our nation, requires
us to harness data and technology in ways

that looks more like a tech company
than a traditional utility.

So, AWS Skills Guild
was really a foundational part of

our cloud journey.
And we took the Skills Guild framework

and modeled it
and tailored it to Duke Energy's needs.

And that was a hint
that cloud isn't a destination for us,

it's a voyage of learning,
exploration and building.

So we started differently and we really
focused on the why. Why cloud, why now?
And we took time to to share

and connect that to our clean energy
transition challenges in the future.
So employees were able to understand more

about why we're going to cloud, and then
more importantly how we were doing it.

And so they've not only seen that we're
one, committed to their growth, but also

we're committed to these technologies
to lead ourselves into the future.

I often remind any of our new employees
that, you're here

not just for what you've learned
and experienced in the past, but

it really is much about what you're going
to learn tomorrow and in the future.

We're starting to see
when learningâ€™s part of your culture,
teams are more willing to try new things

to experiment, fail fast,
but pick it right back up.
And that's the kind of culture

that it's going to take
as we lead through this energy transition.
AWS Skills Guild has been a big part of that.
